name: 1 - Prior mobilisation laydown areas to be indentified and approved by BHP, complete Surface Mobile Equipment Compliance Inspection for approval by the BHP responsible person. Develope Traffic Management Plans (TMP) and associated site specific Traffic Control Plans (TCP) shall be submited to the Company for approval atleast (4) weeks prior to commencement. Implement temporary and permanent protection of existing infrastructure.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Approval of laydown area, SMECI, TMP, and TCP

2 - Ensure sufficient survey control is in place prior to commencing earthwork operation; Survey setout and pickup for construction to be performed to obtain PEAHR, Vegetation, Clearing Permit, and Excavation Permit from BHP to start the excavation/ clearing works. Survey shall use GDA94 MGA Zone 50
APPLICABLE STANDARD: STD-PLN-SUR-001 / SPEC-000-C-00105 Sect. 4.2, Section 5.2 & 7.1 SPEC-000-C-00105 Sect. 5.3.1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey set-out satisfactory; PEAHR
3 - Clear and grub ground surfaces of all stumps and roots;
APPLICABLE STANDARD: STD-PLN-SUR-001 / SPEC-000-C-00105 Sect. 4.2, Section 5.2 & 7.1 SPEC-000-C-00105 Sect. 5.3.1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey set-out satisfactory; PEAHR
4 - Strip topsoil and placed in approved stockpile locations
APPLICABLE STANDARD: Refer Dwgs SPEC-000-C-00105 Sect. 6.2.1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Minimum stripping depth 200mm to a stable base

5 - Any pot holing, test pitting and cable locating required must be carried out in accordance with the approved Excavation Permit in order to verify the location of underground services against the CSMs provided.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Verifying all the points/ locations provided in CSM

6 - Treatment of buried services to be as per WAIO excavation and penetration procedure. CEP ensures excavations comply with all applicable: Acts, Regulations, WAIO Standards, and SPEC-000-C-00105 WAIO Earthworks and IFC documentation relevant to the area to be excavated.
The permit shall be maintained at the work location by the Permit Holder.
The BHP Supervisor shall supervise the task.
APPLICABLE STANDARD: WAIO Excavation and Penetration Procedure SPR-HIS-SAF-001

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to work commencing a task based risk assessment (TBRA) to be completed, changes before or during the work reassess the risk and re-validate or update critical controls. If the location boundary or excavation method requires revision, the Controller Excavation Permit (CEPs) shall approve and document the change.
FREQUENCY: Prior to excavation and during excavation
7 - Fill material to comply with BHP specifications and/or sourced from site locations (Borrow Pit BA2)
– Common Fill > Cut to Fill material on site
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inorganic material, LL < 35%, meets grading curve
○ meets grading curve, LL < 25%, PL < 20%, PI < 9%, LS< 3%, CBR > 45%
8 - Excavate materials to the required lines and levels as per the construction drawings.
APPLICABLE STANDARD: SPEC-000-C-00105 Sect. 7.2 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Lines and Levels as per drawings
9 - Undertake a proof roll test using a Smooth Drum roller or similar with no visual heaving

10 - Testing of all earthworks material, Imported material and general fill must comply with the details in the design drawings and standards specified, and be approved for use by the company representative.
APPLICABLE STANDARD: SPEC-000-C-00105 and DESC-000-C-00002 311010-00413-MEM-001 Rev1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Complaince with the specifications or Approval by company's representative
11 - Place and compact general fill material to lines and level required as per construction drawings. Fill to be placed and compacted in layers of greater than 200mm and less than 300mm
12 - Import, place and compact basecoarse material in a single 200mm layer to the lines and levels as shown on the construction drawings

13 - If where the ballast is removed and the SBC is more than 400mm below the designed RL of the underside of the sleeper. Then treatment to be applied as per DESC-000-C-00001 or as directed by company's representative,
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: RL readings after remediation works or Approval by company's representative
14 - Ballast Depth transitions to be applied to the ends of ballast replacement works.
APPLICABLE STANDARD: Track Maintenance Code of Practice - 0002664, section 2.5.1.2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ballast depth transitions, or as directed by company representative
15 - Trim and finish tops of basecourse to specified tolerances and undertake an As-built survey
16 - Final inspection undertaken by client representative and approval of all work
Signed by Austral Construction / BHP Representative
SJB & Copper Creek Diversion Bunds Checklist
template name: SJB & Copper Creek Diversion Bunds Checklist

name: Ensure that sufficient survey information is available for set out. Establish the correct line and level for excavation and earthworks. Survey pegs to include PEAHR and Construction Boundary.
Clearing, grubbing and stripping of all vegetation, stumps and roots along the footprint of the Creek Diversion Bund
Strip nominated 100mm - 300mm topsoil and placed in approved stockpile locations
Remove unsuitable material encountered at finished sub grade level and replace with approved fill material.

Company representative and Engineer to inspect the bottom of the excavation and approve the placement of fill material. Unsuitable foundation to be boxed out 0.3m minimum and replaced with A4 select fill.
Rip, Condition and Compact existing 300mm subgrade material , to achieve ± 2% modified OMC
Place and compact General and Clayey Fill Material as per bund details and typical sections. Conditioned fill to be placed & compacted in 300mm lifts. Compaction Testing undertaken.
Arrange for BHP Representative to inspect and undertake visual proof roll with roller or loaded 15kL watercart
For guide bund excavate and blace Geotextile Material. Install Facing Class Rip Rap (500mm depth) to drawing levels.
Earthworks have been trimmed and finished to within specified tolerances
– Evenly grade changes between design levels and existing ground level
– Smoothly finished surface with no ruts or disturbances
– Trim to final levels as shown on contract drawings
Arrange with SO for final inspection of finished product
Signed for Austral Construction Pty Ltd:
ITP - SJB Creek Diversion Bund
template name: ITP - SJB Creek Diversion Bund Rev0

name: 1 - Ensure that sufficient survey information is available for set out. Establish the correct line and level for excavation and earthworks. Survey pegs to include PEAHR and Construction Boundary. Excavated Material (from Drain Diversion) as Common Fill material for Diversion Bund – approved by BHP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: BHP excavation permit Survey Data provided by BHP

2 - Clearing, grubbing and stripping of all vegetation, stumps and roots along the footprint of the Creek Diversion Bund. Where topsoil material identified (between 100mm and 300mm depth), strip, load and haul to nominated stockpile areas, no higher than 2.0m.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clear and grub to min 300mm depth below natural surface
○ Where stumps/roots are larger than 200mm girth, Clear and grub 600mm

3 - Remove unsuitable material encountered at finished sub grade level and replace with approved fill material. Company representative and Engineer to inspect the bottom of the excavation and approve the placement of fill material. Unsuitable foundation to be boxed out 0.3m minimum and replaced with A4 select fill
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Visual Inspection Proof Roll

4 - The upper 300 mm below the subgrade shall be scarified by tyning, adding water asnecessary, to achieve ± 2% modified OMC and compacted over every point on the surface, operating in the dynamic mode unless instructed otherwise by the Company Representative. A minimum of 95% MMDD shall be achieved with no visual heaving after rolling.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rip, Condition and Compact existing subgrade
○ Compaction to be 95% MMDD and +/- 2% OMC
5 - Ensure that the material from BHP Billiton's material stockpiles comply with the Specification or BHP approved:

○ BHP Approved Fill Material generally as per Section 11.2.13.2 SPEC 000-C- 00105, be non-dispersive (Emerson class number 5 or higher), have permeability k<10m/d (may be deemed to comply if a minimum of 10% fines is present) and is not gap graded

○ Blending of designated borrow material (A4, gap graded) with Sandy CLAY (CL) material sourced from separate borrow is required to improve the grading. Indicatively a ratio of 0.2 Sandy CLAY to 0.8 GRAVEL - subject to trial Maximum particle size shall remain within specified limits;
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material testing to meet Scope and Specification, Approval by BHP for use
FREQUENCY: Prior to placement of fill

6 - Place and compact approved fill material along length of Bund for Drain Detail Type 1, Type 2 and Type 3. Material to be type C1 General Fill or A4 Select Fill as directed by Company Representative.
– Moisture condition, place and compact in 300mm lifts with 12-19T padfoot roller with vibrating mode up to design levels specified in Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place and Compact moisture conditioned type C1 General Fill or A4 Select Fill
○ Compaction to be 95% MMDD and +/- 2% OMC

7 - For Guide Bund Install Bidim A34 geofabric in areas where overexcavated for placement of Rip Rap rock. Install Riprap rock protection on the Inlet and Outlet apron as shown on construction drawing.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Riprap placed as shown on Dwg Geotextile type Bidim A34 below riprap
FREQUENCY: On completion of excavation for Rip Rap
8 - Trim and finish tops of earthworks to specified tolerances
– Evenly grade changes between design levels and existing ground level
– Smoothly finished surface with no ruts or disturbances
– Trim to final levels as shown on contract drawings
APPLICABLE STANDARD: C-00105 Sect 16 SOW-960-C-12039/2 Project Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: RL top of earthworks = + 25mm Various cross sections
FREQUENCY: After excavation, placement of fill and Rip Rap
9 - Carry out an as-built survey and submit data to BHP
